title: Piers Morgan mocks Greta Thunberg while slamming protestors at McDonald's
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Piers Morgan has taken aim at Greta Thunberg again, this time mocking the climate change activist while slamming the Extinction Rebellion protestors for eating McDonald’s.

The Good Morning Britain host embarked on yet another rant on Tuesday morning after spotting a photo of three protestors ordering food at McDonald’s.

‘I’m glad it rained yesterday because those lot need a damn good shower. Honestly, the hypocrisy that comes from these people,’ Piers began.

‘They went to McDonald’s to eat mass produced meat out of cardboard boxes. Maybe they’re not having a veggie burger, maybe they’re shameless hypocrites going to the epicentre of fast food.

‘How does McDonald’s sit with their eco-warrior – I mean seriously, how does it sit with it?’ he wondered.

After being challenged by Susanna, Piers claimed he’s ‘doing a lot’ for climate change but his co-host celebrated Greta and the protestors for raising awareness about the issue.

That prompted Piers to launch into a ruthless impersonation of Greta, crying out: ‘How dare you? You stole my airtime.’

Oh, Piers.

Piers’ impression of Greta was quite something (Picture: ITV/Rex; Reuters)

Continuing his rant, Piers said of the protestors: ‘They went down and defaced the famous horse with their stupid signs and stuff. We all want to save the planet. I’m not lying down on the floor, defacing the white horse, paralysing traffic in London for two weeks and genuinely behaving like a total imbecile. That’s not how you affect change.

‘They hate them for the destruction they’re causing, they hate them for the smell.’

He added: ‘They’re making it personal to us, they’re saying we’re gas-guzzling horrible people and there they are nipping off to McDonald’s. Shameless hypocrites.

‘They’ll probably be down at Glastonbury won’t they for three weeks. This is the latest jolly.

‘I’d be sick too if I hadn’t washed for two weeks.’
